intro: Nolana quicachaensis, commonly known as the Andean flax, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, temperate climates. Nolana quicachaensis is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
